summary: This document is a request for Special Agent in Charge (SAC) authority to utilize a non-Bureau certified undercover employee in an undercover role related to a civil case involving Jeffrey Epstein. It details the involvement of attorney Bradley James Edwards, who is representing multiple female plaintiffs against Epstein and is dealing with a potential illegal transaction regarding documents related to the case.

persons.name: Bradley James Edwards
persons.context: Edwards is representing four female individuals suing Jeffrey Epstein and is involved in a situation where he is subpoenaing documents related to the case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the subject of the civil lawsuit filed by the individuals represented by Edwards.

persons.name: TFO
persons.context: The TFO is a seasoned police officer who will act as the contact for Edwards in an undercover capacity to collect evidence.

persons.name: SAC
persons.context: The SAC is the authority being requested to approve the use of a non-Bureau undercover employee.

connections.description: Edwards is representing multiple plaintiffs in a civil lawsuit against Epstein.
The TFO will be working under the direction of Edwards to conduct undercover operations related to the case.

events.title: Contact with Document Seller
events.description: Bradley James Edwards was contacted by an individual trying to sell documents related to the civil case against Epstein.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: Edwards served a federal subpoena to an individual to provide documents pertinent to the case against Epstein.

locations: hotel room controlled by the FBI
keyFacts: Bradley James Edwards is representing four female plaintiffs suing Jeffrey Epstein.
Edwards was contacted by an individual attempting to sell documents related to the case.
The individual was demanding $50,000 for the documents, which Edwards deemed illegal.
The FBI is seeking to utilize a non-Bureau undercover employee to facilitate a meeting regarding the document transaction.
The TFO involved is a seasoned police officer with undercover experience.
